raw_comment: In this graph I notice that there is a common theme in which most countries seem to have a higher percentage of 15-24 year olds that believe that the generations get better as they go on where as with the 40 and above age group, they don’t believe that generations get better as they go on. This makes me wonder if the younger age group believes this because they are closer in age to the younger newer generations and grew up in a similar fashion. Rather the older groups have the opposite opinion of the younger generations not being better because they grew up much differently then the older generation. Meaning, they might have different morals or beliefs than the other generation therefore making it difficult for them to understand how the younger generation is being raised. This relates to my community because we are currently living in a generation that is much different than my grandparents generation. A new headline for this graph could be “ New vs. Old”
ace_sentences: I notice a common theme in this graph.
In most countries, the percentage of people who are 15-24 years old is higher than the percentage of people who are 40 years old or older.
Many people who are 15-24 years old believe that generations get better as time goes on.
Many people who are 40 years old or older do not believe that generations get better as time goes on.
I wonder why the younger age group believes this.
The younger age group is closer in age to newer generations.
The younger age group grew up in a similar fashion to newer generations.
I think that these facts can explain the belief of the younger age group.
The older age group grew up very differently from the younger generation.
The older age group believes that the younger generation is not better.
The younger generation may have different morals than the older generation.
The younger generation may have different beliefs than the older generation.
These differences can make it difficult for the older age group to understand the younger generation.
My community lives in a generation that is very different from my grandparents' generation.
A new headline for this graph could be "New vs. Old".
